intro: Nemastylis tenuis var. purpusii, commonly known as the narrowleaf nemastylis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with two lips that are prominent in appearance.
